body_html: Yes, whole replicate part is pretty bad. Doing it once in the init would be awesome, but what if model has changed? Don't trust nvvp traces, though, they are distorted beyond recognition for broadcast/optimizer, because lots of small kernels.
body_text: Yes, whole replicate part is pretty bad. Doing it once in the init would be awesome, but what if model has changed? Don't trust nvvp traces, though, they are distorted beyond recognition for broadcast/optimizer, because lots of small kernels.
body: Yes, whole replicate part is pretty bad. Doing it once in the __init__ would be awesome, but what if model has changed? Don't trust nvvp traces, though, they are distorted beyond recognition for broadcast/optimizer, because lots of small kernels.
